name: Jules Verne
bio: Born in Nantes, Kingdom of France February 08, 1828; DiedMarch 24, 1905. GenreFiction, Science Fiction, Fantasy. InfluencesEdgar Allan Poe, Victor Hugo, Alexandre Dumas, James Fenimore Cooper, ...more. Jules Gabriel Verne was a French author who pioneered the genre of science-fiction. He is best known for his novels Journey to the Center of the Earth (1864), Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea (1870), and Around the World in Eighty Days (1873).

entries.term: Man is never perfect nor contented.
entries.defOrTrans: El ser humano nunca es perfecto ni tampoco está satisfecho
entries.author: Jules Verne

entries.term: I believe cats to be spirits come to earth. A cat, I am sure, could walk on a cloud without coming through.
entries.defOrTrans: Creo que los gatos son espíritus llegagos a la Tierra. Estoy seguro de que un gato podría andar sobre una nube sin colarse a través de ella
entries.author: Jules Verne

entries.term: Man is never perfect nor contented.

name: Marie Curie
bio: 7 November 1867 – 4 July 1934; born Maria Salomea Skłodowska; [ˈmarja salɔˈmɛa skwɔˈdɔfska]was a Polish and naturalized-French physicist and chemist who conducted pioneering research on radioactivity.She was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize, the first person and only woman to win twice, the only person to win a Nobel Prize in two different sciences, and was part of the Curie family legacy of five Nobel Prizes. She was also the first woman to become a professor at the University of Paris, and in 1995 became the first woman to be entombed on her own merits in the Panthéon in Paris.

entries.term: I was taught that the way of progress was neither swift nor easy.
entries.defOrTrans: Me enseñaron que el camino del progreso no era rápido ni fácil.
entries.author: Marie Curie

entries.term: I am among those who think that science has great beauty.
entries.defOrTrans: Estoy entre aquellos que piensan que la ciencia tiene una gran belleza.
entries.author: Marie Curie

name: Nikola Tesla
bio: Nikola Tesla (/ˈtɛslə/;[2] Serbian Cyrillic: Никола Тесла Serbo-Croatian pronunciation: [nikoːla tesla]; 10 July 1856 – 7 January 1943) was a Serbian-American[3][4][5] inventor, electrical engineer,mechanical engineer, physicist, and futurist who is best known for his contributions to the design of themodern alternating current (AC) electricity supply system.

entries.term: Our virtues and our failings are inseparable, like force and matter. When they separate, man is no more.
entries.defOrTrans: Nuestras virtudes y nuestras fallas son inseparables, como la fuerza y ​​la materia. Cuando se separan, el hombre ya no existe.
entries.author: Nikola Tesla

entries.term: In the twenty-first century, the robot will take the place which slave labor occupied in ancient civilization.
entries.defOrTrans: En el siglo XXI, el robot tomará el lugar que el trabajo esclavo ocupó en la civilización antigua.
entries.author: Nikola Tesla
